title: Why are there so many varieties of potatoes? - Quora

response.answer_text: Biological engineering. They are trying to make potatoes for frying, cooking, baking, etc. whilst there were only a few types of potatoe before and they were all suitable for everything. The idea behind many species is to also make them resiliant to insects, bugs, certain foungeses (I am certain I misspelled this one) and other plants.
